column4: Hello?  How can I make sure my kernel is set up for HDMI-delivered audio?
crap

Every system's sound configuration are different. You might want to search for your hardware specs and see if it turned up. For my HTPC, I had to create a configuration file and leave it in ~ for it to work.
aplay -l shows only "analog" ... so the system apprears not to see the digital HDMI port at all?
Is it even toggled on in BIOS?
yes ... and sad to say "it works in Win7" (since I dual-boot)
I'm trying to dump the non-Ubuntu partition and this little glitch is holding me back
!lnw | \\`oot :)
What hardware?
Compaq 8510w
Compaq 8510w laptop
Clean Karmic Installation or Upgrading?
Clean ...
output of "aplay -l" --> card 0: Intel [HDA Intel], device 0: AD198x Analog [AD198x Analog]
I've found a TON about the AD198x hardware ... but everyone seems to have it auto-detected as Analog & digital
How about "sudo lshw -c sound" ?
hold on, I'll paste-bin it, one sec
http://pastebin.com/m1154b80
Any thoughts?  I mean ... Ubuntu recognizes audio, and I get normal fine audio ... just not over HDMI
Sorry. I have to go.  My brother wanted to go to ShopKo with me (because I have large vehicle that can haul furntiures).
thanks anyway
Stick around. Ask. Maybe I'll be back.
